dance.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: a special set of movements performed to a particular type of music
dance.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: The waltz is an easy dance to learn.
the traditional dances and music of Russia
dance.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: a social event or party where you dance
dance.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: Are you going to the dance this weekend?
dance.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: Claire did a little dance of excitement.
dance.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: a piece of music which you can dance to
dance.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: The band was playing a slow dance.
dance.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: the activity or art of dancing
dance.translation[0].note_box[0].section: The drum is often used in Africa to accompany traditional dances.
This is one of the oldest folk dances in Greece.
The Tango is Argentina’s national dance.
We watched the group perform some traditional Spanish dances.
She was practising a complicated dance routine.
Lou was teaching me a few dance steps.
A small band was playing dance music.
dance.translation[0].note_box[1].section: an organized social event where people to go dance
The dance will be held in the school gym.
a large formal occasion where people dance
The University holds a ball at the end of June.
a formal dance party for high school students, especially in the US, usually held at the end of a school year
Who’s your date for the prom?
a dance at which you must wear formal clothes
He rented a tuxedo to wear to his company’s holiday formal.
a place or social event where people dance to recorded popular music
She met Nick at a school disco.
a place where people go at night to dance
We went out for dinner and then to a club.
dance.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: to move your feet and body in a way that matches the style and speed of music
dance.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: They danced to Ruby Newman’s orchestra  (=the orchestra was playing).
The bride danced with her father.
dance.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: to dance in performances, especially in ballet
dance.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: He danced with the Boston Repertory Ballet.
Nakamura dances several solos in this production.
dance.translation[1].definitions[2].defi: to move up, down, and around quickly
dance.translation[1].definitions[2].exam: Pink and white balloons danced in the wind.
